page.title: 11TINSLEY MAINTENANCE DEPOT
page.content: {British Rail}opened the{Tinsley {Depot}in{April 1964.}It is the largest maintenance depot on the{Eastern {Region.}Around{70 locomotives}pass through each day for checking or fuel. The East and West Service Bays can handle{26 locomotives}at any one time. The depot is responsible for{190 {locomotives}in all{(inc.20 shunters). { }Four{25 ton jacks}are used to lift the bodies of the loco's away from the {bogies,}making it possible to change { {wheel-sets and traction motors. { }A{Breakdown Train}is also stationed here and is used to rerail all kinds of stock. It covers an area from{ {Bradford}in the north to{Chesterfield in the south, and from{Kiveton Park}in the east to{Edale}in the west. Workforce:{Traction Engineer, Tech. {Officer, 8 Office Staff & 130 fitters, {cleaners, & electricians (3 shifts).
